meanings.definition: The abnormal protrusion or displacement of an eye.
meanings.sent1: The proptosis of his eye was a clear sign of a serious medical condition.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with proptosis after noticing the bulging of the eye.
meanings.sent3: The proptosis of the eye made it look like it was trying to escape from its socket.
meanings.sent4: Her eye's proptosis seemed to defy gravity, almost as if it wanted to explore the world beyond.
meanings.sent5: The proptosis of the eye was so pronounced that it startled everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: To cause or support the forward movement or growth of something.
meanings.sent1: The fertilizer helped proptosis the growth of the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk proptosised the team towards victory.
meanings.sent3: His encouragement seemed to proptosis the team's spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent4: The new technology proptosised the company's progress into the future.
meanings.sent5: The wind proptosising the sailboat forward filled the sailors with excitement.
